intro: Geum albarracinense var. rigidum, commonly known as the rigid swamp buttercup, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal leaves and yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features include a short, upright stem and is often found in areas with seasonal flooding. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
